column1: Distinguish between the two types of charge, and indicate whether a given pair of charges attract or repel.
Calculate the number of electrons on an object, or the number of electrons gained or lost when the charge on an object changes.
Differentiate between conductors and insulators in terms of the ability of charge to move.
Apply charge conservation to determine charge distribution.
Indicate the directions of the individual forces that several charges exert on a given charge.
Utilize Coulomb's law to relate the magnitude and direction of the force that one or more charges exert on a given charge to the location of and amount of charge on all charges.
Describe what happens to the magnitude of the force between two point charges when the magnitudes of one or both charges and/or the distance between the charges is changed.
